Key Arguments: The legislation represents a form of censorship and overreach by the government.
It threatens free speech and suppresses debate on topics deemed misinformation.
Existing laws already protect against hate speech and threats.
ACMA is unelected and should not have the power to determine misinformation.
The legislation could lead to dictatorship and communistic censorship.
Notable Quotes: This dystopian tyrannical overreach by the commonwealth government to dictate what can and cannot be voiced on social media platforms is removing the freedom to Free Speech.
The book 1984 by George Orwell was supposed to be a warning to us all, not a userâ€™s manual for the Labour Government.
